thread.title: Joseph Goebbels' secretary, Brunhilde Pomsel, dies aged 106
thread.title_full: Joseph Goebbels' secretary, Brunhilde Pomsel, dies aged 106

author: Associated Press in Berlin
title: Joseph Goebbels' secretary, Brunhilde Pomsel, dies aged 106
text:
Nazism Joseph Goebbels' secretary, Brunhilde Pomsel, dies aged 106 
One of last surviving members of Nazi leadership’s inner circle became subject of media interest during her final years Brunhilde Pomsel in a cinema in Munich for a documentary about her work for the Nazis’ propaganda minister. Photograph: Christof Stache/AFP/Getty Associated Press in Berlin Monday 30 January 2017 09.39 GMT Last modified on Monday 30 January 2017 09.43 GMT View more sharing options 
Brunhilde Pomsel, a former secretary of the Nazi propaganda minister Joseph Goebbels , has died aged 106. Joseph Goebbels’ 105-year-old secretary: ‘No one believes me now, but I knew nothing’ Read more 
Pomsel lived most of her life in relative obscurity until a German newspaper published an interview with her in 2011, prompting a flurry of interest in one of the last surviving members of the Nazi leadership’s inner circle. 
Her death was confirmed on Sunday by Christian Kroenes, a director and producer of the film A German Life. In the documentary, Pomsel talks about her three years working for the man responsible for spreading Adolf Hitler’s ideology in newspapers and across the airwaves. 
Kroenes said Pomsel had been lucid when he last spoke to her on her birthday on 11 January. He said she died at her home in Munich on Friday.
